dialogue.text: Vertically, I can reason about the context that surrounds each decision, and infer how my limitations can make me blind to aspects that I might later find obvious once I see them.

psychological_notes: Evan elaborates on his vertical dimension - it's not just going meta, but specifically reasoning about context and recognizing blind spots. He understands that limitations themselves can be invisible until transcended. This meta-awareness of unawareness shows sophisticated psychological insight.
philosophical_underpinning: The paradox of knowing what we don't know we don't know
therapeutic_direction: Client demonstrates awareness of cognitive blind spots
